knockoutMapping.description: (Optional). When "allprops", all collection properties Array<T> will be written in TS as KnockoutObservableArray<T>, and all other properties T will be written in TS as KnockoutObservable<T> (typically used with breeze.js). When "valuetypesonly", object type properties will not be converted to observables (typically used with knockout.mapping plugin).

useBreeze.description: (Optional). When true, all class types X will be written as TS interfaces inheriting from breeze.Entity "interface X extends breeze.entity { [...] }

excludeClass.description: (Optional). When true, all .NET Class types will be excluded TypeScript typings generator.

excludeInterface.description: (Optional). When true, all .NET Interface types will be excluded TypeScript typings generator.

nullableReferenceTypes.description: (Optional). Set to true to propagate nullable reference type information to TypeScript types. NB! Should only be used with assemblies that has enabled nullable reference types.

nonNullableEntities.description: (Optional). When true, properties of .NET class/interface types can not be null in TypeScript.

nonNullableArrays.description: (Optional). When true, properties of .NET collection/array types can not be null in TypeScript.

nonNullableArrayEntityItems.description: (Optional). When true, items of .NET class/interface types can not be null when inside a collection/array type in TypeScript.

nonNullableDictionaries.description: (Optional). When true, properties of .NET IDictionary<TKey, TValue> types can not be null in TypeScript.

nonNullableDictionaryEntityValues.description: (Optional). When true, properties of .NET class/interface types can not be null when in the value of a IDictionary<TKey, TValue> type in TypeScript.

extraProperties.description: (Optional). Enables adding extra properties to ALL generated TS entity interfaces that did not exist in the .NET class. key=propName; value=typeName

assemblyPaths.description: The physical path to the assemblies (dll) containing the POCO objects (absolute path or relative to folder containing config file).

outputPath.description: The physical path to the generated model file (absolute path or relative to folder containing config file).

dotNetRootNamespace.description: The top namespace in the .NET assembly to extract types from. (.NET Types outside this namespace will be ignored).

tsRootNamespace.description: (Optional). The namespace name for the output that replaces the dotNetRootNamespace. (F.ex. to have a shorter namespace in the TypeScript files).

enumType.description: (Optional). If specified, only enums in the listed namespaces will be included. To include enums from "child" namespaces, add a wildcard character after the namespace name. If not specified, all enums under dotNetRootNamespace will be included.

classNamespaceFilter.description: (Optional). If specified, only classes in the listed namespaces will be included. To include enums from "child" namespaces, add a wildcard character after the namespace name. If not specified, all classes under dotNetRootNamespace will be included.

enumNamespaceFilter.description: (Optional). If specified; only Enums in the exact subnamespaces will be included in the output (supports ending wildcard); otherwise all classes under dotNetRootNamespace will be included.

indent.description: (Optional). The string to use for indentation in the generated output (default; 4 space characters).

camelCase.description: (Optional). Whether or not to convert all property names to camelCase in the generated output.

typingsPaths.description: Path to the definitely typed typings files; required when useKnockout or useBreeze is true.

knockout.description: Path to the definitely typed typings file for knockout.

breeze.description: Path to the definitely typed typings file for breeze.

namespaceOverrides.description: Enables overriding the global settings for the specified namespaces. To include enums from "child" namespaces, add a wildcard character after the namespace name.

classOverrides.description: Enables overriding the global settings for the specified classes.
